title: Contemporary avant garde look
content:
Hi all

Does anyone have any sugestion, on a font similar to avant garde geometry but with a modern feel?  
Something like gotham will not work as i'm looking for a font with terminals paralel to baseline like in avant garde or helvetica.

All sugestions are very welcome  
Thanks in advance

Best regards
author: kiko

comments.content:
Helvetica is not very geometric, IMO.

I'm not sure what you mean by “terminals paralel to the baseline”. Are you talking about how Gothams terminals are at an angle, as opposed to completely vertical or horizontal? Perhaps you'd like [Graphik](http://web.archive.org/web/20100818074147/http:/typographica.org/2008/typeface-reviews/graphik/) or [Galaxie Polaris](http://web.archive.org/web/20100818074147/http:/www.vllg.com/Village/Galaxie_Polaris#panel=poster)? (The latter doesn't have the 90 degree terminals, but they are rather close to it.) Another one that might be of interest is [Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20100818074147/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/neuzeit-grotesk/).

Hello

<cite>Are you talking about how Gothams terminals are at an angle, as opposed to completely vertical or horizontal?</cite>

Yes, that's what I was trying to say :). I'm looking for something whitout that angle. And yes helvetica is not as geometric as avant garde, I was just refering it as an example about it's terminals.

Anyway, thanks a lot for your sugestions... very nice, Galaxie Polaris might be just what they're looking for.

Still open to another suggestions though
